A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Visually there were some great moments but I was dead silent when I left the screening......stunned I think.


Bad:
Luke!!!!!?
The story about how Maz got Lukes sabre was ignored.
Where are the Knights of Ren?
Snoke is nobody
Rey's parents are nobody
Fin was wasted in this movie
Rose sucked
Code breaker search thread was stupid
Poe prank call was dumb
Force sensitive street urchin at the end was stupid
Captain Phasma is dead again?
BB-9A had almost no screen time
Many of the beats in Return of the Jedi were mirrored in the Snoke\, Kylo and Snoke scene\, Look at your friends getting killed through my little round window and blah.

There was so clearly a political agenda being pushed throughout with the back and forth of do we or don't we accept sacrifice as an option and lets get as many 
left wing inclusionist boxes ticked and to hell with any real character development.
This was not a good sequel  as it ignores and calls a halt on all that came before it and offers up no hope for the future of the franchise let alone the next movie.  
I believe that it should have been written all as one big story that could be broken into three movies that still contained their own satisfying conclusions while offering cliff-hangers for the next.  
These movies are clearly changing direction with each director/state of the political landscape in the USA/Hollywood and it shows.

Good:
Kylo/Rey battle is wicked cool
Suicide ramming was amazingly cool
Crystal foxes were cool
Cool to see Turbo-lasers vs shields finally
Finally an A-wing yay!
Luke Kylo fight looked great
Poe character arch was cool
Phasma armour deflecting laser blast
Phasma laying down fire with blaster pistol
Yoda was cool old Muppet Yoda
  
So all apart from Poe all of the stuff I liked was purely visual which is not a good thing for any movie these days.
